en.what: COVID-19 is a viral respiratory infection caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus. It spreads through droplets when an infected person coughs, sneezes, or talks.
prevention: Wear a mask in crowded places
remedies: Seek medical help if breathing difficulty or chest pain occurs

en.what: Dengue is a viral infection spread through the bite of Aedes mosquitoes. It causes high fever, joint and muscle pain, and weakness. Severe dengue can lead to bleeding and dehydration.
prevention: Close windows in early morning and evening
remedies: Seek medical help if bleeding or severe weakness occurs

en.what: Malaria is a parasitic infection transmitted through the bite of infected Anopheles mosquitoes. It affects red blood cells and can become life-threatening if untreated.

Tuberculosis (TB) is a bacterial infection caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis. It mainly affects the lungs but can also affect other organs. TB spreads through droplets when an infected person coughs or sneezes.
symptoms: Persistent cough for more than 2 weeks
prevention: Cover mouth while coughing or sneezing
Avoid close contact with infected individuals
remedies: Take full TB medication course as prescribed
Do NOT stop medication even if symptoms reduce

en.what: Influenza (flu) is a contagious viral infection that affects the nose, throat, and lungs. It spreads through droplets when an infected person coughs, sneezes, or talks.
prevention: Avoid close contact with sick individuals
Cover mouth and nose when coughing or sneezing
Wear a mask in crowded places
remedies: Seek medical help if breathing difficulty occurs

en.what: Typhoid is a bacterial infection caused by Salmonella typhi, usually spread through contaminated food or water. It affects the digestive system and can become serious if untreated.
remedies: Seek medical help if symptoms worsen

en.what: Cholera is a bacterial infection caused by Vibrio cholerae, usually spread through contaminated food or water. It leads to severe watery diarrhea and dehydration and can be life-threatening if not treated quickly.
prevention: Avoid raw vegetables and street food
remedies: Seek urgent medical help for severe symptoms

en.what: Chikungunya is a viral infection transmitted through the bite of Aedes mosquitoes. It causes severe joint pain and fever, and recovery may take weeks.
remedies: Avoid aspirin or ibuprofen without doctor advice
Seek medical care if pain is severe

en.what: Hepatitis A is a viral infection that affects the liver, usually spread through contaminated food or water. It often causes jaundice and digestive symptoms but usually resolves with proper care.
prevention: Avoid eating raw or undercooked food
remedies: Seek medical advice if symptoms worsen

en.what: Hepatitis B is a viral infection that affects the liver and spreads through blood or body fluids. It can become chronic and lead to serious liver damage if untreated.
remedies: Consult a doctor for long-term management

en.what: Hepatitis C is a viral infection that spreads mainly through infected blood. It often shows no early symptoms but can lead to chronic liver disease and serious complications if untreated.
remedies: Consult a doctor for long-term treatment

en.what: HIV (Human Immunodeficiency Virus) is a virus that attacks and weakens the immune system, making the body more vulnerable to infections. With proper treatment, people can live long and healthy lives.
remedies: Eat a balanced and nutritious diet
Seek counseling and support if needed

en.what: Measles is a highly contagious viral infection that spreads through the air when an infected person coughs or sneezes. It mainly affects children and can lead to serious complications if untreated.
symptoms: Rash starting on the face and spreading
White spots inside the mouth (Koplik spots)
prevention: Cover mouth and nose when coughing or sneezing
remedies: Humidifier or steam inhalation for cough
Seek medical help if breathing difficulty or severe symptoms occur

en.what: Mumps is a contagious viral infection that primarily affects the salivary glands located near the jaw. It spreads through saliva, coughing, sneezing, or sharing food and drinks.
symptoms: Swelling near the jaw or cheeks
prevention: Avoid sharing food, drinks, or utensils
Cover mouth when coughing or sneezing
Avoid close contact with infected individuals
remedies: Warm or cold compress on swollen areas
Soft foods to reduce chewing pain
Seek medical help if severe swelling or complications occur

en.what: Chickenpox is a highly contagious viral infection caused by the varicella-zoster virus. It spreads easily from person to person through coughing, sneezing, or direct contact with the fluid in blisters.
symptoms: Itchy red blisters filled with fluid
prevention: Avoid close contact with infected individuals
Cover mouth and nose when coughing or sneezing
remedies: Paracetamol for fever (avoid aspirin in children)
Keep nails short to prevent scratching
Seek medical help if breathing difficulty or severe infection occurs

en.what: Jaundice is a condition where the skin and eyes turn yellow due to excess bilirubin in the blood, usually caused by liver problems, infection, or blockage of bile ducts.
remedies: Seek medical help if symptoms worsen

en.what: Pneumonia is an infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs, caused by bacteria, viruses, or fungi. It can be mild or life-threatening, especially in children, elderly, and people with weak immunity.
prevention: Avoid close contact with sick individuals
Strengthen immune system with healthy diet
remedies: Pain relievers for fever and chest pain
Seek urgent medical help if breathing difficulty occurs

en.what: Diarrhea is a condition where a person passes loose or watery stools frequently. It can be caused by infections, contaminated food or water, or digestive disorders, and may lead to dehydration.
remedies: Eat light foods like rice, banana, toast
Seek medical help if symptoms persist or dehydration worsens

en.what: A Urinary Tract Infection (UTI) is an infection in any part of the urinary system, usually caused by bacteria. It commonly affects the bladder and urethra and is more common in women.
prevention: Do not hold urine for long periods
Wipe from front to back after using the toilet
remedies: Use heating pad for pain relief
Seek medical help if fever or back pain occurs

en.what: Diabetes is a chronic condition where the body cannot properly regulate blood sugar levels, either due to lack of insulin or the body's inability to use insulin effectively.
symptoms: Numbness or tingling in hands and feet
remedies: Eat balanced meals with controlled carbohydrates

en.what: Hypertension, or high blood pressure, is a condition where the force of blood against the artery walls remains consistently high. It often shows no symptoms but increases the risk of heart attack, stroke, and kidney disease.
remedies: Seek medical help if chest pain or severe symptoms occur

en.what: A heart attack occurs when blood flow to a part of the heart is blocked, usually due to a blood clot. This prevents oxygen from reaching the heart muscle, causing damage.
symptoms: Pain spreading to left arm, jaw, back, or neck

en.what: A stroke occurs when the blood supply to part of the brain is blocked or when a blood vessel in the brain bursts, leading to brain damage. It requires immediate medical attention.
symptoms: Sudden weakness on one side of the body
remedies: Do NOT give food or drink
Keep the person lying on their side

en.what: Asthma is a chronic condition that affects the airways, causing them to become inflamed and narrowed, making breathing difficult. It can be triggered by allergies, pollution, exercise, or infections.
symptoms: Coughing (especially at night or early morning)
remedies: Sit upright and stay calm during an attack
Seek immediate medical help if breathing worsens

en.what: COPD is a chronic lung disease, often caused by smoking or long-term exposure to pollution, dust, or chemicals. It causes airflow blockage and breathing problems.
prevention: Avoid exposure to pollution and dust
remedies: Seek medical help if breathing worsens

en.what: Cancer occurs when abnormal cells in the body grow uncontrollably and spread to other parts. It can affect any organ and may become life-threatening if not detected early.
symptoms: Changes in bowel or bladder habits
prevention: Eat a healthy diet rich in fruits and vegetables

en.what: Anemia is a condition where the body has a lower-than-normal number of red blood cells or hemoglobin, leading to reduced oxygen transport in the body.
prevention: Avoid excessive tea or coffee with meals
remedies: Eat iron-rich foods like spinach, beans, and red meat
Avoid heavy exercise during severe anemia
Seek medical help if symptoms worsen

en.what: Thyroid disorders occur when the thyroid gland produces too little (hypothyroidism) or too much (hyperthyroidism) hormone, affecting metabolism, energy levels, and body functions.
remedies: Seek medical help if symptoms worsen

en.what: Kidney stones are hard deposits made of minerals and salts that form inside the kidneys. They can block the urinary tract and cause severe pain.
remedies: Drink plenty of water to flush stones
Lemon water to help break stones
Seek urgent help if severe pain or fever occurs

en.what: Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) is a long-term condition where the kidneys gradually lose their ability to filter waste and excess fluid from the blood. It can progress over time and may lead to kidney failure.
symptoms: Swelling in legs, ankles, or feet
prevention: Limit use of painkillers like NSAIDs
remedies: Control blood sugar and blood pressure
Drink fluids as advised by doctor
Seek medical help if swelling or symptoms worsen

en.what: Arthritis is a condition that causes inflammation and stiffness in the joints, leading to pain and reduced movement. It commonly affects the knees, hands, hips, and spine.
prevention: Balanced diet rich in calcium and vitamin D
remedies: Seek medical help if pain worsens

en.what: Migraine is a neurological condition that causes intense, throbbing headaches, often accompanied by nausea, sensitivity to light and sound, and visual disturbances. Attacks can last from hours to days.
prevention: Avoid known triggers (stress, certain foods, lack of sleep)
Avoid loud noises and bright lights
remedies: Rest in a dark, quiet room
Cold or warm compress on head or neck
Caffeine in small amounts may help
Seek medical help for frequent or severe migraines

en.what: Epilepsy is a neurological disorder in which abnormal brain activity causes repeated seizures. Seizures may involve uncontrolled movements, loss of awareness, or unusual behavior.
prevention: Wear protective gear to prevent injury
remedies: Lay person on their side during a seizure
Do NOT put anything in the mouth
Seek medical help for prolonged seizures

en.what: PCOS (Polycystic Ovary Syndrome) is a hormonal disorder in women where the ovaries produce excess male hormones, leading to irregular periods, cysts in ovaries, and metabolic issues.
symptoms: Darkening of skin in neck or armpits
remedies: Seek medical help for fertility concerns

en.what: Dehydration occurs when the body loses more fluids than it takes in, leading to insufficient water for normal body functions. It can result from diarrhea, vomiting, excessive sweating, or inadequate fluid intake.
prevention: Drink ORS during diarrhea or vomiting
Take breaks and hydrate during exercise
remedies: ORS to replace lost salts and fluids
Seek medical help if severe dehydration occurs

en.what: Malnutrition occurs when the body does not receive enough essential nutrients, leading to weakness, weight loss, and increased risk of illness. It can result from poor diet, digestive problems, or chronic disease.
symptoms: Swelling in legs or feet (severe cases)
prevention: Eat a balanced and nutritious diet

en.what: Heat stroke is a severe condition caused by prolonged exposure to high temperatures or strenuous physical activity in hot environments, leading to the body's inability to regulate temperature.
prevention: Avoid direct sunlight during peak heat
Take breaks in shaded or cool areas
Avoid strenuous activity in hot weather
remedies: Move to a cool or shaded place immediately
Apply cold compress or wet cloth
Fan the person to cool down
Do NOT give fluids if unconscious

en.what: A snake bite occurs when a snake injects venom into the body, which can affect the nervous system, blood, or tissues. Not all snakes are venomous, but venomous bites can be life-threatening and require immediate treatment.
symptoms: Swelling and pain at the bite site
prevention: Avoid walking in tall grass or bushes
Wear shoes outdoors, especially at night
Use a flashlight in dark areas
Do not handle or provoke snakes
Keep surroundings clean to prevent rodents
Seal holes and gaps in homes
remedies: Keep the person calm and still
Keep the bite area below heart level
Do NOT apply ice or cut the wound
Hospital treatment with antivenom may be required

en.what: Food poisoning occurs when a person eats food contaminated with bacteria, viruses, or toxins. It commonly happens due to improper food handling, storage, or unhygienic preparation.
prevention: Wash hands before eating or cooking
Avoid street food in unhygienic places
remedies: Eat light foods like rice, bananas, toast
Avoid oily, spicy, and dairy foods
Seek medical help if symptoms persist or worsen

en.what: Skin infections occur when bacteria, fungi, or viruses enter the skin, causing irritation and inflammation. Common types include fungal infections, bacterial infections like cellulitis, and viral infections like herpes.
prevention: Avoid sharing towels, razors, or clothing
remedies: Wash the area with mild soap and water
Keep the area dry and uncovered
Use warm compress for pain relief
Seek medical care if infection spreads or pus forms
Antibiotics or antifungals may be required for severe cases
